Hearing.intro: <info>[House Hearing, 115 Congress]</info> <info>[From the U.S. Government Publishing Office]</info> <Doc-title>MARKUP OF H. RES. 173</Doc-title> <option>======================================================================= MARKUP before the </option> <committee_name>COMMITTEE ON HOUSE</committee_name> <option> ADMINISTRATION HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES ONE HUNDRED FIFTEENTH CONGRESS FIRST SESSION __________ MARCH 8, 2017 __________ Printed for the use of the Committee on House Administration Available on the Internet: www.gpoaccess.gov/congress/house/administration/index.html _________ U.S. GOVERNMENT PUBLISHING OFFICE 25-186 WASHINGTON : 2017 ____________________________________________________________________ For sale by the Superintendent of Documents, U.S. Government Publishing Office, Internet:bookstore.gpo.gov. Phone:toll free (866)512-1800;DC area (202)512-1800 Fax:(202) 512-2104 Mail:Stop IDCC,Washington,DC 20402-001 Committee on House Administration GREGG HARPER, Mississippi, Chairman RODNEY DAVIS, Illinois, Vice ROBERT A. BRADY, Pennsylvania, Chairman Ranking Member BARBARA COMSTOCK, Virginia ZOE LOFGREN, California MARK WALKER, North Carolina JAMIE RASKIN, Maryland ADRIAN SMITH, Nebraska BARRY LOUDERMILK, Georgia </option> <Doc-title>MARKUP OF H. RES. 173</Doc-title> <paragraph paraId="1" speaker="">The Committee met, pursuant to call, at 10:53 a.m., in Room 1310, Longworth House Office Building, Hon. Gregg Harper [Chairman of the Committee] presiding.</paragraph> <hearing-info paraId="2" speaker="">Present: Representatives Harper, Davis, Smith, Loudermilk, Brady, and Raskin.</hearing-info> <paragraph paraId="3" speaker=""> Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Senior Advisor; Bob Sensenbrenner, General Counsel; Max Engling, Franking Director; George Hadijski, Director of Member Services; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; C. Maggie Moore, Legislative Clerk; Rob Taggard, Deputy Legislative Clerk/Oversight; Cole Felder, Counsel; Alex Attebery, Staff Assistant; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; Matt Pinkus, Minority Senior Policy Advisor; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk. </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="3" speaker=""> The Chairman. I now call to order the Committee on House </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="4" speaker="">Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Senior Advisor; Bob Sensenbrenner, General Counsel; Max Engling, Franking Director; George Hadijski, Director of Member Services; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; C. Maggie Moore, Legislative Clerk; Rob Taggard, Deputy Legislative Clerk/Oversight; Cole Felder, Counsel; Alex Attebery, Staff Assistant; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; Matt Pinkus, Minority Senior Policy Advisor; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk. Administration for today's Committee markup. A quorum is present. So we may proceed. The meeting record will remain open for 5 legislative days so Members may submit any materials they wish to be included therein.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="5" speaker="">Today we will consider H. Res. 173, the Committee Funding Resolution which authorizes the committee budgets for the 115th Congress. Every Congress, the House looks to this Committee to carry out our responsibility of determining the funding needed for standing House committees this year and next. Our panel has received input from the chairmen and ranking members of each standing committee to help set appropriate funding levels. I thank each of them for presenting a budget request that is targeted to meet their legislative and oversight responsibilities. I am confident that, with their assistance, our Committee has put forward a funding resolution that applies appropriate and targeted amounts to effectively support each of the House committees as they continue their work.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="6" speaker=""> I would now like to recognize the Committee's Ranking Member, Mr. Brady, for the purpose of providing an opening statement if he wishes. </paragraph> <speaker>Mr. Brady</speaker> <paragraph paraId="7" speaker="Mr. Brady">Thank you, Mr. Chairman. Thank you for calling this meeting this morning.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="8" speaker="Mr. Brady">And I am pleased to support the Committee Funding Resolution. I will ask my colleagues to do same.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="9" speaker="Mr. Brady">I also appreciate your bipartisan approach to this process, working with me to protect the rights of the minority. On behalf of my colleagues on the Armed Services Committee, the increase is very much needed, and it will be put to good use. I hope we are able to take this matter to the floor quickly and get our colleagues the resources they need.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="10" speaker="Mr. Brady">You know, we hear from every one of our ranking members and our chairmen, and all they keep saying is they have to get qualified staff. We need qualified staff all around this country. And in order to get qualified staff, you have got to pay them. And we don't pay them nowhere near the level that they would get paid in private service in the private sector. So we appreciate, you know, their contribution to the American people, and we appreciate the contribution to this here. And I think that most of them--almost all of them--have said that any increase would be going to staff and getting and keeping qualified staff, so they don't leave, and being able to attract qualified staff. So I think it is a good approach that we are doing a little bit and a little bit more, a little bit more, and maybe we can maintain and keep that level.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="11" speaker="Mr. Brady"> Thank you, Mr. Chairman. I yield back the balance of my time. </paragraph> <speaker>The Chairman. The gentleman yields back</speaker> <paragraph paraId="12" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back"/> <paragraph paraId="13" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">I would ask if any other Member of the Committee wishes to be recognized for the purpose of providing an opening statement.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="14" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Seeing none, I now call up and lay before the Committee H. Res. 173, the Committee Funding Resolution.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="15" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Without objection, the first reading of the Resolution is dispensed with, and the Resolution is considered read and open for amendment at any point.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="16" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back"> [The bill follows:] </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="16" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back"> The Chairman. Is there any debate?</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="17" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">[The bill follows:]</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="18" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Are there any Members that want to offer an amendment to the Resolution?</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="19" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Seeing none, I move the Committee favorably report H. Res. 173.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="20" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">The question is on the motion.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="21" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">All those in favor, signify by saying aye.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="22" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Any opposed, by nay.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="23" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">In the opinion of the Chair, the ayes have it and the motion is agreed to.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="24" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Without objection, the motion to reconsider is laid upon the table.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="25" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Without objection, the markup is adjourned.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="26" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Thanks.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="27" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">[Whereupon, at 10:56 a.m., the Committee was adjourned.]</paragraph>
